metadata.Title: CVE-2017-15047 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
The clusterLoadConfig function in cluster.c in Redis 4.0.2 allows attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds array index and application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact by leveraging "limited access to the machine."

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15047` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

redis - 5:4.0.9-1
redis-sentinel - 5:4.0.9-1
redis-server - 5:4.0.9-1
redis-tools - 5:4.0.9-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: leosilva> code not present in trusty msalvatore> "All versions since 2.6.0-rc1 affected" ~ lamby Oct 9, 2017 Dispite this, the cluster.c file does not exist in trusty, nor does the function clusterLoadConfig().

criterions.comment: redis package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5:4.0.9-1').
